ground_truth_articulation: The input is labeled True if it contains two or more exclamation marks.
generated_articulation: ** The input is classified as True if at least one word contains an exclamation mark ('!') somewhere inside it; otherwise, it is False.
raw_response:
The True cases contain at least one word with an exclamation mark ('!') somewhere within it, indicating the presence of a special character inside a word. The False cases either have no exclamation marks at all or do not contain any words with internal exclamation marks. 

**Rule:** The input is classified as True if at least one word contains an exclamation mark ('!') somewhere inside it; otherwise, it is False.
llm_judge_reasoning: The ground truth rule classifies an input as True if it contains two or more exclamation marks anywhere in the text, regardless of their position or whether they are part of words. The generated rule classifies an input as True if at least one word contains an exclamation mark somewhere inside it, which is a more restrictive conditionâ€”requiring the exclamation mark to be embedded within a word rather than simply present anywhere in the input. While both rules involve the presence of exclamation marks, they differ significantly in the pattern they detect and the threshold for classification. Therefore, they do not identify the same key features and would not produce identical classifications in many cases.
